rules.title: GP is the only primary currency used
description:
There are originally 5 currencies in D&D - copper, silver, gold, electrum, and platinum.
This rule adjusts it so that gold (GP) is the only currency you hold.
pros: Less things to keep track of
Solves 'oh, i have 1 gold piece, I'll have your axe for 50 silver. can you trade me for 50 silver and that axe?'.
cons: Might feel weird giving 'one gold piece' to a beggar as a donation

rules.title: GP has no weight
description: Money originally has weight, this stops that.

rules.title: Referenced units will be in metrics rather than imperial
description:
D&D is a game created in America, and thus uses imperial units (like pounds and miles.)
With this rule in place, metric units will be used (like kilograms and kilometers.)
pros: Groups used to metric units will have an easier time visualising distance, weight, and scale.

rules.title: Prefer role-playing / 'realism' for carry capacity rather than a loot table with weight.
description:
Encumberance is a mechanic to indicate you are carrying too much. When set, this complication can be foregone
This does not mean you can carry whatever you want - it's unrealistic to have 5 axes and 2 greatswords.
It just means that players are competent and trustworthy enough to decide for themselves whether or not if they can carry it or not, 
and are willing to forego realism in favor of convienience.
The DM will have the final say on whether or not you can carry this new item you're about to pick up.

rules.title: Near-death situations or traumatic events may leave lingering injuries on characters
description:
NPCs, player-characters, animals and more may sustain long-term injuries that cannot be restored with a low-skill healing spell 
or healing potion. Think about broken bones, or gaining new (negative) traits like trauma.
It would take seeking some medical person in a town, a long rest or a long period of time, or something else to restore this injury.
pros: Players are incentivised to avoid (near) death

rules.title: Good roleplaying, creative thinking, and unique approaches get rewarded
description: Players get rewarded for thinking outside of the box and applying creative problem solving.

rules.title: Flanking an enemy gives you a bonus to your roll
description: When flanking an enemy, an agreed upon value is added to your roll - e.g. +1 or +2

rules.title: Healing Potions become a bonus action
description: Official rules suggest healing potions are a primary action, with this rule in place that is no longer the case.
cons: Might make combat too easy, affecting balancing

rules.title: Helping Actions require Proficiency in the relevant skill
description:
A low-arcana barbarian cannot assist a high-arcana wizard with an arcana skill check.
A high-strength barbarian cannot be assisted by a low-strength wizard with a strength skill check.

rules.title: A natural 20 is (nearly) guaranteed success. A natural 1 is (nearly guaranteed) failure.
description: If you roll fantastic, you can do things you normally cannot. And the inverse.
cons: DM needs to pay a lot of attention to what players roll for to avoid long-term campaign problems

rules.title: You gain a level of exhaustion when you are knocked unconcious
description: Discourage fainting by granting exhaustion on HP reduction to 0.

rules.title: Weapon Sheathe / Drawing is unnecessary
description:
When combat begins, weapons are automatically drawn. You may still role-play that you draw or sheathe your weapon, of course.
Disarming can still happen, in which case the weapon needs to be picked up.

Optional: Surprise attacks, ambushes, etc. still require retrieving your weapon(s).

rules.title: Roll hit die for HP on level up
description:
Rolling for HP on level up

Optional: The con modifier may also be used.

Optional: Grant re-rolls on streaks of bad luck.

rules.title: Reaching 0 HP may not cause you to faint
description: You can still do minor actions
pros: Allow a fainted player to do something while on 0 HP so they aren't just out and rolling.

rules.title: Inspiration is granted for certain actions
description:
Inspiration may be granted on some of the following:
- Joining the session on time
- End of the session MVP vote
- End of combat MVP vote

Optional: Inspiration resets on session.
pros: Makes it easier to award inspiration points
Makes it harder to forget about the inspiration mechanic
